akiFlagger package¶

Submodules¶

akiFlagger.akiFlagger module¶

class akiFlagger.akiFlagger.AKIFlagger(patient_id='mrn', creatinine='creatinine', time='time', inpatient='inpatient', aki_calc_type=None, eGFR_impute=False, add_stages=True, cond1time='48hours', cond2time='168hours', pad1time='0hours', pad2time='0hours', rolling_window=False, back_calculate=False, admission='admission', age='age', sex='sex', race='race', encounter_id='enc', baseline_creat='baseline_creat', sort_values=True, remove_bc_na=True, add_baseline_creat=False, add_min_creat=False)¶

Bases: object

Main flagger to detect patients with acute kidney injury (AKI). This flagger returns patients with AKI according to the KDIGO guidelines on changes in creatinine*. The KDIGO guidelines are as follows:

  • Stage 1: 0.3 mg/dL increase in serum creatinine in < 48 hours OR 50% increase in serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

  • Stage 2: 100% increase in (or doubling of) serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

  • Stage 3: 200% increase in (our tripling of) serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

*Except for the stage 3 condition of a creatinine value larger than 4.0 mg/dL. This paper has the full specifications including inclusion criterion based on urinary output and renal replacement therapy.

More information can be found in the documentation at akiflagger.readthedocs.io.

patient_id¶

default ‘mrn’. Name of the column used to identify patients; e.g. ‘PAT_MRN_ID’

Type

string

encounter_id¶

default ‘enc’. Name of the column used to identify encounters; e.g. ‘PAT_ENC_CSN_ID’

Type

string

time¶

default ‘time’. Name of the column containing time stamps; e.g. ‘time’

Type

string

inpatient¶

default ‘inpatient’. Name of the column containing inpatient/outpatient identifier; e.g. ‘inpatient’

Type

string

admission¶

default ‘admission’. Name of the column containing the admission dates; e.g. ‘admission’

Type

string

creatinine¶

default ‘creatinine’. Name of the column containing creatinine values; e.g. ‘creatinine’

Type

string

baseline_creat¶

default ‘baseline_creat’. Name of the column containint baseline creatinine values; e.g ‘baseline_creat’

Type

string

age¶

default ‘age’. Name of the column containing the age values; e.g. ‘age’

Type

string

sex¶

default ‘sex’. Name of the column containing the age values; e.g. ‘age’

Type

string

race¶

default ‘race’. Name of the column containing the age values; e.g. ‘age’

Type

string

aki_calc_type¶

defaults to None. Name of the AKI-calculation method the flagger should perform. Possible values are “rolling_window”, “back_calculate”, or “both”.

Type

string

rolling_window¶

default True. Whether to perform rolling-window AKI calculation.

Type

boolean

back_calculate¶

default False. Whether to perform back-calculate AKI calculation.

Type

boolean

eGFR_impute¶

default False. Whether or not to impute the missing baseline creatinine values with the eGFR-imputation method; i.e. assuming an eGFR of 75 estimate baseline creatinine based on age, sex, and race.

Type

boolean

add_stages¶

default True. Whether or not to have rolling-window AKI delineated into stages. If add_stages is True, the generated rw column dtype is int64 otherwise the rw column dtypes is bool.

Type

boolean

cond1time¶

default ‘48hours’. The rolling-window time of the first KDIGO criterion condition. This string gets passed to pd.Timedelta(cond1time), so any acceptable time format for that function will work.

Type

string

cond2time¶

default ‘168hours’. The rolling-window time of the second KDIGO criterion condition. This string gets passed to pd.Timedelta(cond2time), so any acceptable time format for that function will work.

Type

string

pad1time¶

default ‘0hours’. Padding to add to the first KDIGO criterion condition. This string gets passed to pd.Timedelta(pad1time), so any acceptable time format for that function will work.

Type

string

pad2time¶

default ‘0hours’. Padding to add to the second KDIGO criterion condition. This string gets passed to pd.Timedelta(pad2time), so any acceptable time format for that function will work.

Type

string

sort_values¶

default True. Whether or not to sort the values within each encounter based on time.

Type

boolean

remove_bc_na¶

default True. Whether or not to convert the back-calculated NaNs to Falses.

Type

boolean

add_baseline_creat¶

default False. Whether or not to add the baseline creatinine column from back-calculate method.

Type

boolean

add_min_creat¶

default False. Whether or not to add the minimum creatinine column from rolling-window method.

Type

boolean

addAdmissionColumn(df, add_encounter_col=None)¶

Returns the admission (and possible encounter) column(s) in case the patient data frame is missing the admission/enc column.

addBackCalcAKI(df, baseline_creat=None)¶

Returns aki based on back-calculation method. Requires baseline_creat from `addBaselineCreat()` function as an intermediate to calculate aki.

addBaselineCreat(df)¶

Returns baseline creatinine used in intermediate calculation for back-calculated AKI.

addRollingWindowAKI(df)¶

Returns the AKI conditions based on rolling window definition. Returns the rolling-window as a pandas series (and possibly the minimum creatinine values, if add_min_creat=True).

Parameters

df (pd.DataFrame) – patient dataframe, with encounet & time as the indices.

Returns

calculated rolling-window series. If add_stages=True then the series returned is of type int64 otherwise it is of type bool. min_creat (pd.Series): potentially returns min_creat if add_min_creat flag is set to True.

Return type

rw (pd.Series)

eGFRbasedCreatImputation(age, female, black)¶

Imputes the baseline creatinine values for those patients missing outpatient creatinine measurements from 365 to 7 days prior to admission. The imputation is based on the CKD-EPI equation from the paper A New Equation to Estimate Glomerular Filtration Rate (Levey et. Al, 2009).

returnAKIpatients(dataframe, add_stages=None, cond1time=None, cond2time=None, pad1time=None, pad2time=None)¶

Returns patients with AKI according to the KDIGO guidelines on changes in creatinine*. The KDIGO guidelines are as follows:

  • Stage 1: 0.3 increase in serum creatinine in < 48 hours OR 50% increase in serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

  • Stage 2: 100% increase in (or doubling of) serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

  • Stage 3: 200% increase in (our tripling of) serum creatinine in < 7 days (168 hours)

More information can be found in the documentation at akiflagger.readthedocs.io. :param df: Patient dataframe, should include some sort of patient and encounter identifier(s) and age, sex, race, serum creatinine and timestamps. :type df: pd.DataFrame

Returns

Patient dataframe with AKI patients identified.

Return type

df (pd.DataFrame)

Raises

AssertionError – If the dataframe is missing an expected column; e.g. if there is no age/sex/race and eGFR_impute is True.

akiFlagger.akiFlagger.generate_toy_data(num_patients=100, num_encounters_range=(1, 3), num_time_range=(5, 10), include_demographic_info=False, date_range=None, time_delta_range=None, creat_scale=0.3)¶

Generates toy data for demonstrating how the flagger works.

Parameters

  • num_patients (int) – integer, default 100. Number of patients to generate

  • num_encounters_range (tuple) – tuple, default (3, 10). Number of encounters per patient will be randomly selected from a range between this tuple.

  • include_demographic_info (bool) – boolean, default False. Whether or not to include the demographic information in the generated dataset

Returns

df (pd.DataFrame): dataframe with toy numbers to work with.
